intro: Crotalaria globosa, commonly known as the globe thornvetch, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its distinctive globular seed pods and small, yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in dry conditions. Crotalaria globosa is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, making it beneficial in soil enrichment.
